sect1.title: What are Desktop Effects?
sect1.para: Ubuntu includes special desktop effects, which are intended to make your desktop more fun and easier to use. These include:

Desktop effects are enabled by default, but it is not necessary to have them turned on. In addition, users of computers with certain graphics cards may find that desktop effects do not work well on their computer, or cause the computer to operate more slowly than it would with the effects turned off.

sect1.title: Configuring Desktop Effects
sect1.para: Press &desktop-effects; to change basic options relating to desktop effects.

listitem.para: Select No effects to disable desktop effects.
Select Normal effects to enable basic desktop effects.
Select Extra effects to enable all desktop effects.

sect1.para: When you select a new option, it may take several seconds for the change to be applied automatically. During this time, your screen may flicker briefly.

sect1.title: Advanced configuration
sect1.para: Further configuration of desktop effects is possible, although less straightforward.

listitem.para: Press AltF2, type gconf-editor and then press Run to start the Configuration Editor.
Navigate to /apps/compiz and change the relevant settings.

sect1.para: It is possible to change many settings relating to desktop effects using the Configuration Editor. See the Compiz documentation website for full instructions on how to do this.

sect1.title: Problems with Desktop Effects
sect1.para: If you experience problems when using desktop effects, it is advisable to disable them by pressing &desktop-effects; and selecting No effects.

listitem.para: If you receive the following error message, it is likely that your graphics card does not currently support desktop effects:

para.guilabel: Desktop effects could not be enabled

listitem.para: In this case, you will not be able to use desktop effects.

If your computer runs slowly, disabling desktop effects may improve performance. Desktop effects require more system resources, and so older or less powerful computers may not be able to cope with the extra load.
See the Ubuntu Community Support pages for more information on desktop effects in Ubuntu.
See the Compiz documentation website for more information on advanced configuration of desktop effects.
